sub_title: Technial Advisor Capacity Development at The National Association of Social Housing Organisations (NASHO)
summary:
My main interest over the almost 40 years in education is learning, organisational learning and organisational development and topics related to this. Trained as a language teacher and working in various highschools I realised that one can easily spend a lifetime in this field. Since I joined the social housing sector in 1988 I realised that learning in organisations and organisational development is directly related to language an communication and I never looked back. Over the years I have been involved in many projects as a project manager or as a member of a project team or as an executive/ non-executive board member in various boards. The common denominator in all this was excitement of people working together and learning to overcome differences and challenges and in the end achieving something we set out to do. And this is what me still keeps excited: the miracle of achieving something with other people within a team or in a role as coach or facilitator

Since 2015 I am retired but still working as a Technical Advisor/Consultant Capacity Development for NASHO but based in Deventer in the Netherlands. Since Corona my work for NASHO has come to an end. I am fully retired now and focus on other interests. Since 2020 I am a volunteer at EICAS (European Institute for Contemporary Arts and Science). It is the first contemporary art museum in Deventer and is housed in a monumental schoolbuilding from the 1950's. It focuses on Zero Art and contemporary artist that work from the same inspiration. I am an attendant and also involved in the Educational committee.

My specialties are:
Facilitation, presentation, training and curriculum development, learning and organizational learning, organizational development especially in the field of rental/social housing

profile_positions.company: National Association of Social Housing Organisations (NASHO)
profile_positions.description: NASHO is a membership based organisation of social housing organisations in South Africa. It provides services to its members, influences the main stakeholders in the sector to create a conducive environment for social housing. As technical advisor I am responsible for the development of capacity development programmes for the sector both standard as well as customized programmes.
profile_positions.title: Technical Advisor Capacity Development

profile_positions.description:
Siyafunda was established in 2005 to 'support individual disadvantaged learners and the direct environment through and in which the learning takes place, by making resources available that will enhance sustainability.

(Disadvantaged learners are learners who, through the circumstances they are in, are not able to perform to the standard they should be capable of.)'
The Trust works closely with the School Governing Bodies (SGBs) of two primary schools: one in Tembisa a township on the east rand of Johannesburg and one in Centane in rural Eastern Cape. The main support of the Trust is through the sourcing of funding for projects such as the provision of schooluniforms to poor learners, money for education school outings, libraries, educational tools etc. It is directly linked to the Stichting Siyafunda based in the Netherlands which raises funds in the Netherlands.
profile_positions.title: Chair of the Board of Directors

profile_positions.description: SHiFT was established in 2002 as a non-profit organisation that wants to promote a 'SHiFT' in the thinking and practice of human settlements in South Africa. Over the years it has done this through advocacy, training, publications and a bi-annual innovation in social housing design competition for students at the schools of architecture in South Africa. Although there has been a lot of changes in the housing landscape in South Africa into the direction of more mixed (tenure type, income, etc.) and inclusive humane human settlements and the change of the name of the National Department of Housing into the Department of Human Settlements, there are still many challenges facing the lower income housing sector in South Africa.
profile_positions.title: Board Member, Acting Chair

profile_positions.description: The Social Housing Foundation (SHF) was an organisation established by the National Department of Housing to initiate, promote social housing in South Africa and to facilitate the establishment and management of social housing institutions throughout the country. It did this through development of policy, research, training and development. The SHF was closed in December 2010. It is succeeded by the Social Housing Regulatory Authority (SHRA) the body that regulates the social housing sector through accreditation of SHIs and makes grant funding availble to accreditated social housing institutions and private sector rental housing agencies.
profile_positions.title: Technical Advisor Capacity Building

profile_positions.description: The predecessor of 'Atrium Training en Opleiding' was the Department of Training and Development of the 'Nationale WoningRaad' (NWR, National Council) an umbrella organisation of the social housing insitutions in the Netherlands. The NWR has been succeeded by 'Aedes, vereniging van woningcorporaties' and Atrium has been replaced by 'Kjenning, training en opleiding'. One of the main acitivities I was responsible for in Atrium besides training and facilitation was quality management.
profile_positions.title: Deputy Director/Trainer, Facilitator
